Detailed Description

A simple example implementation of a MACSimServerInterface.

This class provides an example of how to create a MACSim server by subclassing MACSimServerInterface. This example expects two inputs, and provides one output. The output is expected to be provided at a 100Hz sampling frequency. At each sample time, the single output is calculated simply as the sum of the two inputs. To use this example a sample Simulink model is provided in the same directory as this file.

virtual void Simple::getSimOutputs (  ColumnVectorAliasConstant &  in,
ColumnVectorAlias &  out
)  [inline, virtual]
 

Use the inputs to calculate the output value.

The output value is the sum of the two inputs

Parameters:
in The input column vector, this will be two elements long
out The output column vector, this will be one element long (effectively a scalar).
